snippet: Greece will soon be able to receive more than 40 billion euros, or $52 billion, in desperately needed loans to recapitalize its banks and keep the government functioning.
abstract: Greece persuades local banks and foreign investors to sell back to the government 32 billion euros worth of discounted bonds, clearing way for more than 40 billion euros in desperately needed loans to recapitalize its banks and keep the government functioning.
lead_paragraph: Greece will soon be able to receive more than 40 billion euros, or $52 billion, in desperately needed loans to recapitalize its banks and keep the government functioning.

headline.main: Greece Buys Back Debt, Clearing Way for More Aid
headline.print_headline: Greece Buys Back Debt, Clearing Way For More Aid
